alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chittenden; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms will impact portions of Interstate 89 through the Green Mountains in east central Chittenden and west central Washington Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 425 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms over Bolton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Brief, heavy rainfall may rapidly limit visibility and pond on the Interstate resulting in hydroplaning. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waterbury Village, Bolton, Waterbury, Middlesex, Moretown, Duxbury, North Moretown and North Duxbury. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 58 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is occurring with this line of storms and may lead to rapidly reduced visibility and cause ponding on road surfaces. It`s best to reduce speed below 50 mph to limit chances of hydroplaning.
